payloads.defensive_notes:
Education-only template (non-executing).
- Root cause: reflecting user input into HTML without encoding.
- Defenses: contextual output encoding (HTML), safe templating/auto-escaping, CSP.
- WAFs may detect signatures, but correct output encoding is the core fix.
payloads.description: Demonstrates reflected XSS risk when untrusted input is placed into the HTML body without proper contextual output encoding.
payloads.title: Reflected XSS (HTML context) - Template

payloads.defensive_notes:
Education-only template (non-executing).
- Stored XSS can affect many users because the payload is persisted.
- Defenses: encode at render time, input normalization/validation, CSP.
- Ensure consistent escaping across all render paths.
payloads.description: Demonstrates stored XSS concept: input is persisted and later rendered into HTML body.
payloads.title: Stored XSS (HTML context) - Template
